title: Authors and Citation
text: Benjamin Skov Kaas-Hansen. Author, maintainer. Anders Granholm. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kaas-Hansen BS, Granholm (2023). hrqolr: R package simulating health-related quality life trajectories. https://inceptdk.github.io/hrqolr/
code: @Manual{,   title = {{hrqolr}: an R package for simulating health-related quality of life trajectories},   author = {Benjamin Skov Kaas-Hansen and Anders Granholm},   year = {2023},   url = {https://inceptdk.github.io/hrqolr/}, }

what: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: Package simulating randomised clinical trials temporal trajectories health-related quality life (HRQoL) outcome, quantify effect sizes single-sampled HRQoL values end follow-area trajectories. Developed part INCEPT (Intensive Care Platform Trial) project (https://incept.dk/), primarily supported grant Sygeforsikringen “danmark” (https://www.sygeforsikring.dk/).

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: Website - stand-alone website full package documentation Health-related quality life trajectories critical illness: protocol Monte Carlo simulation study - article Acta Anaesthesiologica Scandinavica outlining first scientific study use hrqolr

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: First, load package: preferred way design scenario using setup_scenario function validate input give right format. Set verbose = FALSE silence validation results. Getting overview final scenario: scenario hand, can sample number example trajectories visualise :  sample_example_trajectories returns ggplot, allowing fine-tune appearance needs. example, breaking apart trajectories arms apart facets hide legend (remember load ggplot2 first). , also set arm-level trajectory black make stand better:  can also summarise trajectories, e.g., inter-quartile ranges. ribbons become bit wonky end follow-due increasingly observations might low:  scenario specification can, , used simulate desired number trials. default hrqolr print progress updates console (silence verbose = FALSE): returned object contains quite lot interesting information. example, summary statistics arm: –head--head comparisons arms:
code: library(hrqolr) #> Loading 'hrqolr' package v0.0.0.9005. #> For help, run 'help("hrqolr")' or check out https://inceptdk.github.io/hrqolr/. scenario <- setup_scenario(     arms = c("A", "B"),     n_patients = 100,     sampling_frequency = 14,     index_hrqol = 0.0,     first_hrqol = 0.1,     final_hrqol = c(A = 0.8, B = 0.7),     acceleration_hrqol = c(A = 1.1, B = 1.0),          mortality = 0.4,     mortality_dampening = 0.0,     mortality_trajectory_shape = "exp_decay",     prop_mortality_benefitters = 0.0, ) #> arms                         valid as is       #> n_patients                   modified      100 --> c(A = 100, B = 100)    #> index_hrqol                  modified      0 --> c(A = 0, B = 0)    #> first_hrqol                  modified      0.1 --> c(A = 0.1, B = 0.1)    #> final_hrqol                  valid as is       #> acceleration_hrqol           valid as is       #> mortality                    modified      0.4 --> c(A = 0.4, B = 0.4)    #> mortality_dampening          modified      0 --> c(A = 0, B = 0)    #> mortality_trajectory_shape   modified      "exp_decay" --> c(A = "exp_decay", B = "exp_decay")    #> prop_mortality_benefitters   modified      0 --> c(A = 0, B = 0)    #> sampling_frequency           modified      14 --> c(A = 14, B = 14) scenario #> arms                                    A           B #> n_patients                            100         100 #> index_hrqol                             0           0 #> first_hrqol                           0.1         0.1 #> final_hrqol                           0.8         0.7 #> acceleration_hrqol                    1.1           1 #> mortality                             0.4         0.4 #> mortality_dampening                     0           0 #> mortality_trajectory_shape      exp_decay   exp_decay #> prop_mortality_benefitters              0           0 #> sampling_frequency                     14          14 example_trajs <- sample_example_trajectories(scenario, n_digits = 3) plot(example_trajs) library(ggplot2)   plot(example_trajs, arm_aes = list(colour = "black")) +     facet_wrap(~ arm) +     theme(legend.position = "none") plot(example_trajs, "summarise", ribbon_percentiles = c(0.25, 0.75)) sims <- simulate_trials(scenario) #> 2023-10-24 11:07:42: Estimating ground truth of arm 'A' (0 secs) #> 2023-10-24 11:07:42: Building data.table with patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:42: Finding unique patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:42: Estimating for 691 unique patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:43: Assigning results to all (non-unique) patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:43: Starting arm 'A' (1.46 secs) #> 2023-10-24 11:07:43: Building data.table with patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:43: Finding unique patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:43: Estimating for 3888 unique patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:49: Assigning results to all (non-unique) patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:49: Estimating ground truth of arm 'B' (7.36 secs) #> 2023-10-24 11:07:49: Building data.table with patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:49: Finding unique patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:49: Estimating for 674 unique patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:51: Assigning results to all (non-unique) patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:51: Starting arm 'B' (8.83 secs) #> 2023-10-24 11:07:51: Building data.table with patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:51: Finding unique patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:51: Estimating for 3825 unique patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:56: Assigning results to all (non-unique) patients #> 2023-10-24 11:07:57: Finished (14.97 secs) #> 2023-10-24 11:07:57: Sampling example trajectories (15.28 secs) #> 2023-10-24 11:07:57: Wrapping up, returning output (15.4 secs) sims$summary_stats #>                      outcome arm  analysis     p25     p50     p75    mean    sd    se #>  1:    primary__hrqol_at_eof   A title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: hrqolr isn’t CRAN yet can installed GitHub remotes package installed: can also install development version directly GitHub. requires remotes-package installed. development version may contain additional features yet available stable CRAN version, may unstable lack documentation.
code: # install.packages("remotes")  remotes::install_github("INCEPTdk/hrqolr") remotes::install_github("INCEPTdk/hrqolr@dev")

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: use GitHub issue tracker bug/issue reports proposals enhancements.

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: welcome contributions directly code improve performance well new functionality. latter, please first explain motivate issue. Changes code base follow steps: Fork repository Make branch appropriate name fork Implement changes fork, make sure passes R CMD check (neither errors, warnings, notes) add bullet top NEWS.md short description change, GitHub handle id pull request implementing change (check NEWS.md file see formatting) Create pull request dev branch adaptr

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: using hrqolr, please consider citing :
code: citation(package = "hrqolr") #> To cite package 'hrqolr' in publications use: #>  #>   Kaas-Hansen BS, Granholm A (2023). hrqolr: an R package for #>   simulating health-related quality of life trajectories. #>   https://inceptdk.github.io/hrqolr/ #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {{hrqolr}: an R package for simulating health-related quality of life trajectories}, #>     author = {Benjamin Skov Kaas-Hansen and Anders Granholm}, #>     year = {2023}, #>     url = {https://inceptdk.github.io/hrqolr/}, #>   }

title: Caching of hrqolr functions — cache_hrqolr
text: TODO: Later , may implement memoisation logic lighter memoise.

title: Caching of hrqolr functions — cache_hrqolr
code: cache_hrqolr(   max_size = 1 * 1024^3,   max_age = Inf,   max_n = Inf,   logfile = NULL,   evict = "lru" )  clear_hrqolr_cache()

title: Caching of hrqolr functions — cache_hrqolr
text: max_size Maximum size cache, bytes. cache exceeds size, cached objects removed according value evict. Use Inf size limit. default 512 megabytes. max_age Maximum age files cache evicted, seconds. Use Inf age limit. max_n Maximum number objects cache. number objects exceeds value, cached objects removed according value evict. Use Inf limit number items. logfile optional filename connection object logging information written. log console, use stderr() stdout(). evict eviction policy use decide objects removed cache pruning occurs. Currently, "lru" "fifo" supported.

Defaults FALSE. acceleration_hrqol scalar [0, Inf), acceleration HRQoL improvement compared baseline trajectory first_hrqol_arm scalar, HRQoL ICU discharge (arm level) final_hrqol_arm scalar HRQoL end follow-(arm level) sampling_frequency int (scalar named vector), span HRQoL sampling patients n_digits int, number digits HRQoL values. digits yield greater precision also cause longer run-times.

title: Interpolate multiple values — hrqolr_approx
text: Stripped-version stats::approx. underlying C code exactly included hrqolr unexported stats package.

title: Interpolate multiple values — hrqolr_approx
code: hrqolr_approx(x, y, xout, yleft = -Inf, yright = Inf, method = 1, f = 0)

title: Interpolate multiple values — hrqolr_approx
text: x, y numeric vectors giving coordinates points     interpolated.  Alternatively single plotting structure can     specified: see xy.coords. xout optional set numeric values specifying     interpolation take place. yleft value returned input x values     less min(x). default defined value     rule given . yright value returned input x values     greater max(x). default defined value     rule given . method specifies interpolation method used.  Choices     "linear" "constant". f method = "constant" number 0 1     inclusive, indicating compromise left-     right-continuous step functions. y0 y1     values left right point value     y0 f == 0, y1 f == 1,      y0*(1-f)+y1*f intermediate values. way result     right-continuous f == 0 left-continuous f     == 1, even non-finite y values.

title: Interpolate multiple values — hrqolr_approx
text: Interpolated values

code: sample_example_trajectories(scenario, ...)  # S3 method for hrqolr_scenario sample_example_trajectories(   scenario,   n_example_trajectories_per_arm = 50,   n_digits = 2,   seed = NULL,   valid_hrqol_range = c(-0.757, 1),   ... )  # S3 method for default sample_example_trajectories(   arms,   sampling_frequency,   index_hrqol,   first_hrqol,   final_hrqol,   acceleration_hrqol,   mortality,   prop_mortality_benefitters,   mortality_trajectory_shape,   mortality_dampening,   n_example_trajectories_per_arm,   n_digits,   seed = NULL,   valid_hrqol_range,   ... )

Defaults deterministic value based arguments given (ensuring reproducibility default). valid_hrqol_range two-element numeric vector, lower upper bounds valid HRQoL values. default (c(-0.757, 1.0)) corresponds Danish EQ-5D-5L index values.

what: Helper for setting up valid scenarios — setup_scenario
title: Helper for setting up valid scenarios — setup_scenario
text: Inputs validated ensure produce expected results given input simulate_trials. Therefore, arguments function can also just single value (except arms argument), function expand single-valued arguments compatible simulate_trials. arguments named vectors, must exactly one value per arm, names must match given arms.

title: Helper for setting up valid scenarios — setup_scenario
code: setup_scenario(   arms = NULL,   n_patients = NULL,   index_hrqol = NULL,   first_hrqol = NULL,   final_hrqol = NULL,   acceleration_hrqol = NULL,   mortality = NULL,   mortality_dampening = NULL,   mortality_trajectory_shape = NULL,   prop_mortality_benefitters = NULL,   sampling_frequency = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Helper for setting up valid scenarios — setup_scenario
text: arms character vector names arms n_patients named int (scalar named vector), number patients index_hrqol numeric (scalar named vector), HRQoL index (= enrolment) first_hrqol numeric (scalar named vector), HRQoL ICU discharge arm final_hrqol numeric (scalar named vector), HRQoL end follow-arm acceleration_hrqol numeric (scalar named vector), relative acceleration HRQoL improvement arm mortality numeric (scalar named vector) [0, 1], mortality end follow-, arm mortality_dampening numeric (scalar named vector), dampening effect HRQoL ICU discharge patients die end follow-mortality_trajectory_shape character (scalar named vector), valid values "exp_decay" (default), "linear", "constant", "reflected_exp_decay" can differ across arms. prop_mortality_benefitters numeric (scalar named vector) [0, 1], proportion patients arm -called mortality benefitters. sampling_frequency int (scalar named vector), span HRQoL sampling patients verbose logical, function provide detailed output validation results? Default: TRUE

title: Helper for setting up valid scenarios — setup_scenario
text: object class 'hrqolr_scenario' validated inputs.

title: Workhorse — simulate_trials.default
text: Internal function really invoked user directly. arguments given must named vectors.

title: Workhorse — simulate_trials.default
code: # S3 method for default simulate_trials(   arms,   n_patients,   sampling_frequency,   index_hrqol,   first_hrqol,   final_hrqol,   acceleration_hrqol,   mortality,   mortality_dampening,   mortality_trajectory_shape,   prop_mortality_benefitters,   n_trials = 100,   n_patients_ground_truth = 1000,   n_example_trajectories_per_arm = 50,   include_trial_results,   test_fun,   verbose,   n_digits,   valid_hrqol_range,   alpha,   max_batch_size,   seed = NULL,   ... )

title: Workhorse — simulate_trials.default
text: arms character vector names arms n_patients named int (scalar named vector), number patients sampling_frequency int (scalar named vector), span HRQoL sampling patients index_hrqol numeric (scalar named vector), HRQoL index (= enrolment) first_hrqol numeric (scalar named vector), HRQoL ICU discharge arm final_hrqol numeric (scalar named vector), HRQoL end follow-arm acceleration_hrqol numeric (scalar named vector), relative acceleration HRQoL improvement arm mortality numeric (scalar named vector) [0, 1], mortality end follow-, arm mortality_dampening numeric (scalar named vector), dampening effect HRQoL ICU discharge patients die end follow-mortality_trajectory_shape character (scalar named vector), valid values "exp_decay" (default), "linear", "constant", "reflected_exp_decay" can differ across arms. prop_mortality_benefitters numeric (scalar named vector) [0, 1], proportion patients arm -called mortality benefitters. verbose logical, function provide detailed output validation results? Default: TRUE ... used

title: Simulate trials — simulate_trials
text: key user-facing function simulating trials.

title: Simulate trials — simulate_trials
code: simulate_trials(scenario, ...)  # S3 method for hrqolr_scenario simulate_trials(   scenario,   n_trials = 100,   n_patients_ground_truth = 1000,   n_example_trajectories_per_arm = 50,   test_fun = welch_t_test,   include_trial_results = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   n_digits = 2,   valid_hrqol_range = c(-0.757, 1),   alpha = 0.05,   max_batch_size = NULL,   seed = NULL,   ... )

title: Simulate trials — simulate_trials
text: scenario object class 'hrqolr_scenario', output setup_scenario ... passed methods n_trials int scalar vector. vector, simulations run batches size given n_patients_ground_truth int, many patients (per arm) use estimating ground truth n_example_trajectories_per_arm int, number example trajectories include returned object test_fun function used compare estimates. default welch_t_test (built hrqolr). Note function handle number arms provided. See Details . include_trial_results logical, indicates whether trial-level results kept. Default FALSE resulting object may large many trials simulated. verbose logical, function give progress timestamped updates? Default: TRUE n_digits int, number digits HRQoL values. digits yield greater precision also cause longer run-times. valid_hrqol_range two-element numeric vector, lower upper bounds valid HRQoL values. default (c(-0.757, 1.0)) corresponds Danish EQ-5D-5L index values. alpha scalar [0, 1], desired type 1 error rate used comparing HRQoL arms. max_batch_size int, maximum number patients process batch. default use run one batch (.e. upper limit) seed int, optional seed reproducible pseudo-random number generation. Defaults deterministic value based arguments given (ensuring reproducibility default).

title: Simulate trials — simulate_trials
text: object class hrqolr_results, specialised list four elements: summary statistics arm, comparisons (incl. performance metrics), seed elapsed time.

title: Simulate trials — simulate_trials

title: Verify input is single integer or numeric (potentially within range) — verify
code: verify_int(x, min_value = -Inf, max_value = Inf, open = "no")  verify_num(x, min_value = -Inf, max_value = Inf, open = "no")  verify_chr(x, valid_values = NULL)

title: Verify input is single integer or numeric (potentially within range) — verify
text: x value check. min_value, max_value single integers decimal numbers, lower upper bounds x lie. open single character, determines whether min_value max_value excluded . Valid values: "" (= closed interval; min_value max_value included; default value), "right", "left", "yes" (= open interval, min_value max_value excluded). valid_values vector valid values (characters)

title: Verify input is single integer or numeric (potentially within range) — verify
text: Single logical.

title: Verify input is single integer or numeric (potentially within range) — verify

title: Welch's t test — welch_t_test
text: Custom stripped-version R's built-t.test yields estimate confidence interval corresponding specified alpha level.

title: Welch's t test — welch_t_test
code: welch_t_test(   vals,   grps,   arms = unique(grps),   na_replacement = NULL,   alpha = 0.05 )

title: Welch's t test — welch_t_test
text: vals numeric vector grps character vector, allowed values "ctrl" "actv" used slice x two vectors values compared. arms character vector arms used grps parameter. first value used comparator. na_replacement scalar (NULL), NULL missing values removed. Otherwise, missing values replaced value na_replacement alpha numeric, 1.0 - confidence_level

title: Welch's t test — welch_t_test
text: four-element vector point estimate, p value confidence internal
